intro: Oenothera suffulta, commonly known as the showy evening primrose, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial plant that typically grows in dry, disturbed soils. The plant produces showy yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Oenothera suffulta is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its ecological importance in supporting pollinator populations.
